definition: sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to

sentences.english: And as they cried out and threw off their garments, and cast dust into the air.
sentences.chinese: 他们遂喧哗呐喊，扔下衣服，并向空中扬土。

sentences.english: And can you hear the sound of hysteria?The subliminal mindfuck America.
sentences.chinese: 你能听到这歇斯底里的呐喊吗？

sentences.english: Members of the class committee and other trainees made up a cheering squad and shouted encouragement for the players.
sentences.chinese: 班委会成员与其他学员组成啦啦队为大家呐喊助威。

sentences.english: As soon as the gates were opened, crowds of football supporters piled in.
sentences.chinese: 门一打开，成群的为足球赛呐喊助威的人涌了进来。

sentences.english: I apologize for my record of minuets to those who cry from the depths.
sentences.chinese: 我为我的小步舞曲唱片向在深渊呐喊的人致歉。

sentences.english: The power of your ear-splitting war cry echoes across the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 你震耳欲聋的战争呐喊在战场上回荡。

sentences.english: Children root for their local football (soccer) team in Dublin.
sentences.chinese: 都柏林的孩子们正在为他们的当地足球队呐喊助威。

sentences.english: Here there is no city in the horn sound and noisy chants.
sentences.chinese: 这儿没有城市中的喇叭声和嘈杂的呐喊声。

sentences.english: They are wavers of flags and shouters of slogans.
Wave upon wave of field cheerleading chants.
sentences.chinese: 场上啦啦队的呐喊声一浪高过一浪。

sentences.english: Inoue Yasushi calls on the World Peace by dint of Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 井上靖借助孔子来积极为世界和平而呐喊。

sentences.english: He reached the camp as the army was going out to its battle positions, shouting the war cry.
sentences.chinese: 到了辎重营，军兵刚出到战场，呐喊要战。

sentences.english: Under Kongming's order, the vessels advanced in single file, their prows pointed west. The crews began to roar and pound their drums.
sentences.chinese: 孔明教把船只头西尾东，一带摆开，就船上擂鼓呐喊。

sentences.english: The port is near, the bells I hear, the people all exulting.
sentences.chinese: 港口已经不远，钟声我已听见，万千人众在欢呼呐喊。

sentences.english: I want to leave you but go to, the battle cry of the history disallows to stop over again.
sentences.chinese: 我要离你而去了，历史的呐喊不允许再停留。

sentences.english: A day of the trumpet and alarm against the fenced cities, and against the high towers.
sentences.chinese: 是吹角呐喊的日子，要攻击坚固城和高大的城楼。

definition: to shout loudly/to raise a cry/to yell
to sing loudly/fig. to mouth slogans
to cheer for/to encourage/to boost the morale of
to call out (a name etc)/to shout
